question.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will 20 Democrats oppose early Biden nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this event will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Then, in this scenario, will at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? This resolves YES if such a letter is signed by at least 20 lawmakers before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also count. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

question.title: Will both Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024, and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination of Biden by July 21, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; (2) A public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024. Otherwise, this question resolves to "No".

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Suppose the above is true: Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. Then, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (b) Kamala Harris’ VP Pick is either Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th. This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question explores the potential political dynamics if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution criterion for this condition is that Nikki Haley must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Given this scenario, the outcome we are interested in is whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby making the Vice President serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). It does not matter how long the incapacity lasts for this question to resolve as YES.

It should be noted that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count for this question. The context involves discussions around the potential invocation of the 25th Amendment as raised by a GOP lawmaker.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump leads Biden by more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: A positive value in the polling average indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The specific range for this question is a Trump lead greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points.

Then, is the following true: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for this outcome: This resolves as YES if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. All other outcomes resolve as NO, regardless of who receives the nomination on election day.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. (b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Armenia qualify as well?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Czechia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and asks whether Armenia will also qualify.

Resolution criteria for P: The condition is met if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Q: The outcome will be resolved as **Yes** if Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia does not qualify, the outcome will resolve as **No**.

If Czechia does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both Czechia and Armenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Czechia and Armenia participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Armenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final as well?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia also participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if Georgia qualifies under these conditions, and **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will both Iceland and Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both countries do not meet these conditions, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Given Deadpool & Wolverine has the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, will Taylor Swift cameo in the movie?
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie, potentially setting a record with a $360 million global opening weekend, surpassing the original Deadpool's $284.5 million. This would mark the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie, confirmed by Hollywood Reporter or equivalent.

(a) Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

(b) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on the same nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will France place in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between a nation winning multiple women's team sports and France's performance in the overall medal table.

Suppose the following is true: The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This means that at least two of the gold medals in women's team sports (association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo) are won by teams representing the same NOC.

Then, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves positively if France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) based on the total medal count, prioritized by gold, then silver, then bronze medals. It resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport, and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports (association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo). This means that at least one NOC must win at least two of these events.

(b) France places in the Top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by the total number of medals won, ordered by the number of Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, then Bronze Medals in case of ties.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as Yes. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024)? The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The combined question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) to invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics. This requires a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as No if either or both of the above conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: If Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will Joe Biden announce he is dropping out and resigning before July ends?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions:

1. **Condition**: Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

2. **Outcome**: Will Joe Biden announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if such announcements are made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, even if he has not formally resigned by then.

Given the condition is met, does the outcome occur?

question.title: Will the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 AND will Joe Biden announce both his withdrawal from the race and his resignation before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. (2) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Otherwise, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: If the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will they win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the USA's overall performance at the 2024 Paris Olympics and their success in a specific sport, basketball. 

Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table calculated by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals. This resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

Then, is it true that Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics? Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 and win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball?
question.body: This question resolves positively if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, according to the medal table calculated by the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. (2) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. It resolves negatively if either condition is not met.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): Resolves YES if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Resolves NO if these conditions are not met by that date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Conditional on the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still president at the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces dropping out and resigning by end of July, will Kamala's odds of winning increase in the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. This announcement does not require him to have formally resigned and be out of office by then; the intention to do so is sufficient.

Given this scenario, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is greater than 46.6%, and NO otherwise.

This question combines the conditions of Biden's announcement and the subsequent change in Harris's odds as per Nate Silver's model.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July, and (b) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part.

Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals and Will an Athlete Win >1 Medal for Tennis at the Paris 2024 Olympics?

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: If Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure him to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This interview must be in-person and not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Given this condition, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group collectively speaking with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes, and will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure him to drop out, both before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following occur:

(a) Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

(b) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). The group must act collectively, such as by signing a letter or speaking with Biden in person. Five individuals separately expressing their opinions is not sufficient.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, this question resolves YES. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

question.title: If France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario: Suppose France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, which will resolve positively if France ranks in the top 5 (ties included) based on the total number of medals, ordered by gold, silver, and then bronze medals. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

Given this condition, the question then asks whether a terrorist attack will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics. For this, a terrorist attack must injure and/or kill at least one person (excluding the terrorist(s)) between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question resolves as Yes if such an attack occurs and No otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) A terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) France will place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics if they rank within the top 5 countries by total medals, with ties resolving positively, based on the number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The resolution is ambiguous if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

(b) A terrorist act will be considered to have occurred in metropolitan France if, between 26 July 2024 and 11 August 2024, an attack injures or kills at least one person (excluding the terrorist(s)), and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024. Specifically, this means that before August 1, 2024, one of the following four events occurs, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, then the condition is not met.

Given this condition, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, and (b) Biden remains President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

This resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

(b) Will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

This resolves as YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The polling average must show Trump's lead as greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, including but not limited to Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine. It will resolve as **No** if the location is not under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains or Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives.

A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as No if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: Given Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains, Assessed Russian Control, or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine. Then, between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024), will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France that injures/kills at least one person other than the terrorist(s)? An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024**: This condition will be satisfied if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location
   The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

2. **A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics**: This condition will be met if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of the above conditions are not met.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

question.title: Given Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, consider two Manifold polls closing on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Public opinion polls show Joe Biden losing to Trump outside the margin of error, but other Democrats poll ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

question.title: Given the VXVCLS is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The reported number for July 20, 2024, must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? 

This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) The question regarding Donald Trump will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and asks whether, under this condition, a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to pressure Joe Biden to consider ending his re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

Resolution criteria for the condition: Ron DeSantis must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is not related to who receives the nomination on the election day.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party members work together to ask Biden to end his campaign before July 20th, either through a signed letter or a collective in-person request. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. If these criteria are not met, resolves NO.

question.body:

1. Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Unnamed democrats or separate statements do not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date, and any ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO.

If both of these criteria are met, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both are not met, it resolves as **No**.
