question.title: Will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Serbia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Finland also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Finland qualify for the Grand Final as well? 

The resolution criteria for Finland are as follows: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Serbia and Finland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Serbia or Finland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question examines the scenario where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election on July 15, 2024. The data is accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Given this scenario, will Joe Biden drop out or otherwise be unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time? If Biden drops out before this time, the question resolves to yes. Otherwise, it resolves to no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Biden drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. The lead must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4.

(b) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Given a Trump family member is the Republican nominee in 2024, will Joe Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family, such as Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden participate in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if any of the listed Trump family members is the Republican nominee. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden has an in-person interview of at least 45 minutes released before the end of July 2024, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It must include 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if both of the following occur:

1. One of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

2. Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must feature at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. Appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, can count if they meet the 45-minute footage requirement.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed from the primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

Then, is it true that there will be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

The question resolves as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Lithuania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will San Marino qualify as well?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Lithuania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024. This means that Lithuania participated in a Semi-final and was officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Then, is it true that San Marino will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 as well? This means San Marino must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria:
- **Condition (P):** Lithuania qualifies for the Grand Final, confirmed by the EBU.
- **Outcome (Q):** San Marino qualifies for the Grand Final, confirmed by the EBU.
- If Lithuania does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both Lithuania and San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Lithuania or San Marino does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Biden remains President through July 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President for this purpose.

Then, is it true that Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates resolve as NO. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Given ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Renew hold the most seats?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If ECR holds the most seats but Renew does not, this resolves as **No**. In case of a tie, both ECR and Renew must be among the groups tied for the most seats for a **Yes** resolution.

question.title: Will both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Conditional on Chris Christie being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Doug Burgum also be the nominee?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Chris Christie and Doug Burgum are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. However, typically only one candidate is chosen as the nominee, so if Chris Christie is selected, it is unlikely Doug Burgum would also be chosen, and vice versa.

Resolution criteria: Resolves **Yes** if both Chris Christie and Doug Burgum are selected as nominees by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Resolves **No** if only Chris Christie is selected and not Doug Burgum. If neither is selected, the condition is not met and the question resolves as **N/A**.

question.title: Will both Chris Christie and Doug Burgum be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Chris Christie and Doug Burgum are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is a hypothetical scenario as typically only one candidate is selected as the nominee. However, for the purpose of this question, both must be selected for it to resolve as **Yes**. The selection is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Conditional on Russia having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine. Then, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question will resolve as Yes if the location is under any category indicating Russian control as per the ISW map. It will resolve as No if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves No otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? (b) Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Australia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ukraine also qualify?

question.title: Will both Australia and Ukraine qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Latvia and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Given 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out, as reported by the New York Times source. Then, will a person representing the Republican Party win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson, as reported by credible sources? If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (2) the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(1) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(2) Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: If the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, is it true that facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Donald Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, and (b) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) The Crimean Bridge will be considered hit with an attack if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to its integrity.

(b) Trump will be considered to have gained at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Conditional on the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee being a Woman, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Then, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Resolves 'yes' if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves 'no' if a male is selected.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): Resolves 'yes' if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves 'no' otherwise.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman AND Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as 'Yes' if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (2) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

The question will resolve as 'No' if either of these conditions is not met.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will he announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before the end of Friday, July 26th, as confirmed by an official announcement. Then, will there be a definitive, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle?

Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Portugal qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Iceland also qualify?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Portugal successfully qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It asks whether, under this condition, Iceland will also qualify for the Grand Final. 

Resolution criteria for Portugal qualifying: This condition is met if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Iceland qualifying: This outcome is true if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

question.title: Will both Portugal and Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: If Ukraine qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ukraine qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

If Ukraine does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ukraine qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Ukraine qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024: This will occur if Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ukraine does not qualify, this condition is not met.

(b) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024: This will occur if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The condition is not met if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: If Kamala Harris becomes President by Friday, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be verified through official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?

There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat.

This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close. The percentage is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This is determined by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

(b) In two Manifold polls closing on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The percentage is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this percentage difference is >= 0.03.

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Given stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21, will the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, have a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, departs the International Space Station (ISS) by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The departure is confirmed if the Starliner has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth. The resolution source for this event will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a Planetary K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6? This question resolves Yes if the highest Kp in that period is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21, 2024, and (b) Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, the strongest geomagnetic storm has a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body:
(a) The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel. This condition will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth. The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

(b) This condition resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between Trump's polling lead and the Republican nomination process.

Condition: Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024. This is based on the data reported by 538 on that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves as **No** if any other candidate is selected. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden dropping out at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Now, given this scenario, we want to know: If President Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 US Presidential race, will a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if a reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance. Resolves NO if they do not. Resolves N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) if Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

2. If President Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 US Presidential race, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. The question will resolve as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, official, and unambiguous, leaving no room for the possibility that he would accept the nomination.

Given this, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, and will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 convention?
question.body:
Will both of the following occur:

(a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This requires a definitive, public, official announcement by Joe Biden or his campaign before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) There is another Democratic party presidential debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention.

Both conditions must be satisfied for a Yes resolution. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?

Then, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) The Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the number reported by the St. Louis Fed on that date is greater than the number reported on July 20, 2023. See: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) The Republican Party will be considered to have retained Ohio's 6th congressional district if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. In case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

question.title: Conditional on Israel expanding its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024. This will resolve as Yes if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

Then, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"></iframe>

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body:
Suppose Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Joe Biden drop out or be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time for this to resolve as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden will drop out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will drop out before July 13, 2024: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Georgia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Switzerland also qualify?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 1) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and 2) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Georgia does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A. If Georgia qualifies but Switzerland does not, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both Georgia and Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on at least 5 countries winning their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Olympics, at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal. This means that 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

Then is it true that at least 5 countries will win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games? This resolves as Yes if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal AND at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if BOTH of the following occur: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, AND (b) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: If at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Politico reports that there are efforts among Democratic members to urge Biden to end his re-election campaign. This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic US House Members or Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The group must communicate their message collectively, such as by signing a letter or speaking with Biden in person. Reports of unnamed democrats will not suffice unless at least 5 names are made public before the deadline.

Suppose this condition is met. Then, will Ron DeSantis be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves YES if Ron DeSantis is chosen as the nominee by the convention delegates.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th (b) Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguity will result in a NO resolution. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as YES if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the election day itself.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, is it true that as of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This would be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are met on July 15, 2024, and "No" otherwise. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election**: This occurs if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or subsequent events.

2. **Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment**: This condition is met if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. Official confirmation must come through state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports or unofficial announcements do not count.

The question resolves as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: If at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria for condition: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for outcome: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this market will resolve to YES. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan AND will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if BOTH of the following occur:

(a) A public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. This includes multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, as reported by the New York Times.

If either of these criteria is not met, this question resolves to NO.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Conditional on a Trump family member being the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family, specifically one of the following individuals: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. Then, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for condition: The condition resolves as **Yes** if one of the aforementioned Trump family members is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It resolves as **No** if any other candidate, including a member of the Trump family, is selected. This is determined solely by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and (b) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question resolves as **Yes** only if both of the following conditions are met:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and (b) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
