Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)* before June 1, 2024, and (b) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. For condition (b), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before July 2024, will Trump gain 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Given this, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? This is determined by two Manifold polls closing on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another with a generic Democrat. The market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result for the Biden poll minus the result for the generic Democrat poll is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, AND will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be released before the market close at the end of July 2024. Qualifying appearances include podcasts or late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. 

(2) Donald Trump must gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. This is determined by two Manifold polls closing on July 6. The first poll has Joe Biden on the hypothetical ballot, and the second has a generic Democrat. The percentage of votes for Trump in poll 1 must exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is >= 0.03.

Both conditions (1) and (2) must be met for the combined question to resolve YES.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Given ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Republicans Party of France form an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body:
This question explores the potential political landscape in France contingent on the outcome of the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections.

Suppose the following is true: The European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats, including in the case of a tie, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, is it true that the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) will form a political alliance with the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the 2024 French legislative election? This resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between these parties, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) The Republicans Party of France forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. (b) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Azerbaijan qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Denmark also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Denmark also participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Will both Azerbaijan and Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Kimberly Cheatle must resign, be fired, or otherwise no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The market resolves to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability than Joe Biden. If they have equal odds, it resolves 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days? (b) Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? This will resolve to "Yes" if Biden is projected as the favorite and "No" if Trump is projected as the favorite. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Estonia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Austria qualify as well?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Austria participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Will both Estonia and Austria qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Estonia and Austria participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Estonia or Austria does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, did someone intentionally shoot a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th? Resolves YES if an intentional shot was made. Resolves NO if an accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) someone intentionally shoots at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Did someone intentionally shoot a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th? This resolves as Yes if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on that date. It resolves as No if the shooting was due to an accidental discharge or ricochet, or if the projectile was not plausibly lethal like a bullet (e.g., a BB gun pellet).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through the end of July 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains the US President through the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect this condition as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

Given this condition, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This question resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes** based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being removed or blocked from the primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This removal must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not be reversed by that date.

Given this condition, will Chris Christie be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Christie is selected as the nominee, and NO otherwise. The resolution is not based on the nominee at the time of the election, but solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from any U.S. state's primary election ballot for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolution is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that Trump's lead over Joe Biden according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4? For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment AND will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

Then, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and **No** otherwise. The resolution is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This part will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part will resolve as **No**.

question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. question.body:

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The Boston Celtics must win the 2024 NBA Finals. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Real Madrid wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League and (b) the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
(a) The question about Real Madrid resolves "Yes" if Real Madrid wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams resolve "No".

(b) The question about the Boston Celtics resolves as **Yes** if the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

The combined question resolves as "Yes" only if both (a) Real Madrid wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League and (b) the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 13, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue his run before the specified time, otherwise NO.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. (b) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?

For the outcome (Q): Resolves Yes if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P):
- Resolves YES if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- Resolves NO if any other candidate is selected.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q):
- Resolves YES if Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.
- Resolves NO if no such qualifying interview is released before the end of July 2024.
- Does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Mike Pence must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. 

(b) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview, conversation, or similar setting on camera for at least 45 minutes of new footage before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls, but includes appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. If no such qualifying interview is released before the end of July 2024, this condition resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, is it true that Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as Yes if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. The selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM.

Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria for Kamala's odds: Resolves YES if the probability is >46.6% at the specified time. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Iran's military response: Resolves YES if Iran initiates a military action as defined, and NO otherwise. Only actions officially acknowledged by Iran or confirmed by credible reporting count. Proxy attacks do not count.

question.title: Will both Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model and Iran initiate a military response before August 13th?
question.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. (2) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this resolves NO.

For condition (1), see Nate Silver's model: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

For condition (2), a "military action" is any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, including airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count. Proxy forces' actions do not count.

question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will the US government end Verisign's .com management agreement?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes the specified announcement before the deadline. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the US Department of Commerce ends the agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals at Paris 2024, will Russian athletes be barred from competing?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

Then is the following true: Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as "Yes", no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as "No". If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by other means does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given this, will there be credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties before June 6th, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 (b) There is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP and (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case this component will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election. (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Conditional on an athlete winning more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will France place in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Suppose this condition is met.

Then, will France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024? The resolution criterion for France's placement involves calculating the medal table by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, the question will resolve ambiguously. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals in tennis, and (b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals, 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals, 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? The FiveThirtyEight forecast's resolution will use the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Biden remains President through end of July 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024. This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Note that temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause him to cease being President.

Then, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? Specifically, will any of the following events occur, according to official statements or credible reports, before that date:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then the answer is No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. This includes any of the following events:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No. This question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.body:

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.
