Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that the party of the Prime Minister of France will not be New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will OpenAI commit to "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" by July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. ChatGPT refers to the general web interface, not the API, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

Then, is it true that OpenAI will publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024? This requires OpenAI to make a public statement indicating a new level of commitment to this principle, verified by Metaculus to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step."

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (b) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **OpenAI's ChatGPT General Availability in the EU:** ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. If unavailable in certain EU countries, or to certain groups like minors, it will still resolve positively if >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively even if the name or website has changed, as long as the service is substantially the same.

2. **OpenAI's Commitment to "No Retaliation for Public Risk Disclosure":** Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a spokesperson. The statement must indicate a new level of commitment relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published. Metaculus must verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **YES**; otherwise, it resolves as **NO**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by other means does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given this situation, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures would also be sufficient. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Biden declared incapacitated: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) At least 20 Democrats sign letter: Resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures suffice.

Context: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing to oppose the party’s effort to seal Biden’s nomination sooner than planned, arguing it stifles debate about his candidacy. A drafted letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) signals this opposition.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement is unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

- Donald Trump
- Donald Trump Jr.
- Eric Trump
- Ivanka Trump
- Tiffany Trump
- Melania Trump
- Barron Trump

The question resolves as Yes if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, and will a Trump family member be the Republican nominee in 2024?
question.body:
Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Details for each component:

(a) Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this part resolves as No.

(b) Resolves as Yes if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. If none of these individuals is the nominee, this part resolves as No.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: If Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this condition, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Francis Suarez will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Francis Suarez is the nominee selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and NO otherwise. The question is not restricted to candidates currently mentioned, and other options may be added in the future.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
1. This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

   a. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

   b. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on another Democratic party presidential debate occurring, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Then, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is such a Democratic debate. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention and will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (2) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO if either or both conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. Then, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if, following the date of the question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, AND (b) Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP nominee, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will Joe Biden remain the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

Resolution criteria for P: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is met. If someone else is selected as VP, it is not met. The condition is based on the initial nomination and does not change even if the VP is changed later.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP (2) Biden remains President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is met. If someone else is selected as VP, this condition is not met. The condition is evaluated based on the initial nomination, and any subsequent changes do not affect it.

(2) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024: This condition is met if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It is not met if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause the condition to be unmet.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Kamala Harris' VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. 

Then, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, 2024? Resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris' VP pick be either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. Resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals overall at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins the gold medal in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. Resolves NO if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals overall at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball and win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following occur: (1) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (2) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. It resolves No otherwise.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. Then, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? (b) Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: If the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will the Greens–EFA political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Resolves as No for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman (b) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and (b) The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections.

Will resolve “no” if either (a) the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election, or (b) the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections.

For condition (b), if two groups are tied for seats, this condition will resolve as **Yes**. This condition resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

question.title: If there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 6, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. Then, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**. If there are no credible reports of armed forces conflict deaths between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (b) diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

2. Before June 1st, 2024, one of the following events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If both conditions are not met, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on the men's 100m dash winning time breaking the Olympic record at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Russian athletes be barred from competing?
question.body:
At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, the men's 100m dash winning time will break the Olympic record if any athlete runs the race in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

We want to know if, given this record-breaking performance, Russian athletes will be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics. This will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag. Specifically, no more than 34 Russian athletes can be present for the condition to resolve as **Yes**. This will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, the question resolves as **No**. If the Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, the question resolves as ambiguously.

question.body:

1. The men's 100m dash winning time at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics is less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources.

2. Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If either the 100m dash record is not broken or more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this question resolves as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, is it true that Mike Pence will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. The question is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

(b) Mike Pence will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will both Cyprus and Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

If either Cyprus or Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will testify at the hush money trial? This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment and testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: Given a swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis?

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals (b) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis?
question.body: (a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The attack is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. 

Given this, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The question about the terrorist act will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) The question about the Prime Minister will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes by July 2024, will 538 project him as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include podcasts, late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Given this condition, will FiveThirtyEight project Joe Biden as the favorite to win the US presidential election on July 19, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves NO if Donald Trump has a higher probability than Biden. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it resolves 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this resolves according to the nearest previous figures.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO.

(b) Joe Biden must have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning than Donald Trump, and “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability than Joe Biden. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question explores the relationship between diplomatic tensions in Southeast Asia and political stability in the United States. Suppose the following is true: Before June 1, 2024, diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China. This means one of the following events occurs: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines, according to official statements or credible reports. Given this situation, will Joe Biden remain President of the United States through the end of July 2024? This resolves as YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024 (b) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions):
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

(b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

If both conditions are not met, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?

question.title: Given Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This means that credible reports indicate an attack attributed to Iran within Israel's borders, leading to the death of at least five individuals, occurs before May 1, 2024. Given this situation, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? The announcement must be definitive, public, official, and leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, and (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

2. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Glenn Youngkin being the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Glenn Youngkin will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

2. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

question.title: Will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Given Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024. Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): This resolves Yes if Tadej Pogačar is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024 (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024? (b) Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:

question.title: Will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Given the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the Boston Celtics winning the 2024 NBA Finals and the performance of the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) on July 20, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): The Boston Celtics must be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): The VXVCLS must be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed reporting here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals and will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

If either or both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Conditional on Rishi Sunak failing to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This means that for any reason, he does not secure a seat as an MP, as confirmed by credible media reports or official announcements from the returning officer of the constituency where he was a candidate.

Given this condition, will Francis Suarez be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution of this question depends solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as their nominee for the presidential election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election and (b) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: If Joe Biden has an in-person interview of 45+ minutes before July 2024, will Scotland hold a sanctioned independence referendum before May 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This interview must not be a press conference, speech, rally, fundraiser, or town hall, and must include at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Examples of qualifying interviews include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is sufficient footage.

Then, is it true that Scotland will hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024? This referendum must occur with the consent of the UK government and may be advisory, but cannot be a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum without UK government permission.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (b) Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. The interview must be released before the end of July 2024.

(b) Scotland must hold a referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. The referendum may be "advisory" and does not need to be legally binding, but it must have the consent of the UK government. It cannot be a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum without UK government permission.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: If INC forms the government after the 2024 Indian general election, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections in May 2024. Then, is Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question resolves as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The question resolves **Yes** if Trump's lead is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4, and **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The INC forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard winning the Tour de France 2024, will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The cyclist officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024 must not be Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning than Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Trump has a higher probability. Resolves 50-50 if both have equal odds.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.
