question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Given at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. These polls ask "has weak AGI been achieved," without defining the term, allowing respondents to vote based on their own understanding. The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses.

Suppose at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. Then, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of the following occurs according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, then this resolves as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body: (1) Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. The polls ask "has weak AGI been achieved," allowing respondents to vote based upon their own understanding. Progress has been steady with previous poll results increasing over time. The July 2024 poll will resolve YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3. "No opinion" respondents will be ignored. (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China will resolve YES if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following occur: The Philippines expels or recalls a diplomat from China, or China expels or recalls a diplomat from the Philippines, according to official statements or credible reports. If both conditions are met, this question resolves to YES; otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Conditional on Iran initiating a military action against Israel before August 13, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This includes any use of force executed by Iran that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Additionally, only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count, excluding attacks by proxy forces.

Given this, will any of the following events occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if any of the aforementioned diplomatic actions occur before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. Otherwise, it resolves as NO. If the condition regarding Iran's military action is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions are excluded. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory are included. Proxy attacks do not count.

(b) Before August 1, 2024, one of the following events occurs: The Philippines expels a PRC diplomat, recalls a diplomat from the PRC, the PRC expels a Filipino diplomat, or recalls a diplomat from the Philippines, according to official statements or credible reports.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Pandemic Agreement is approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) according to reports from credible sources. Then, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The Pandemic Agreement must be approved in a vote at the May 2024 WHA.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russians competing. Resolves NO if more than 34 Russian athletes compete. Resolves ambiguously if the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, and (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this question will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Given the US maximum weekly hospitalization rate peaks within four weeks of the combined peak, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the US during the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for all three, as per CDC's RESP-NET data. This is based on epidemiological weeks, considering the season from October 7, 2023, to June 1, 2024.

Then, is it true that 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20? The resolution will be based on the New York Times interactive page, resolving to YES if 10 or more Democratic Senators are listed at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, and (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will "deepfake" be said in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Then, will Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators say "deepfake" during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, in Atlanta? This resolves as Yes if the word "deepfake" is uttered by any of them during the debate broadcast. Otherwise, it resolves as No. The determination will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and will "deepfake" be said in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:

1. The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this part. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

2. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has occurred will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript. If the word is not clearly uttered, this part resolves as NO.

Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on ECR holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question resolves as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (2) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Given the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, as determined by the data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL using the exact (not rounded) value. Then, is it true that credible sources will report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Given the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats, even in the case of a tie with another group.

Now, given this situation, will Donald Trump Jr. be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will resolve as **Yes** if he is selected, and **No** for all other candidates, regardless of current mentions or future additions.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports, and (b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either or both of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on the Olympic record for the men's pole vault being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. Then, will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024)? An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be considered broken if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.
(b) A terrorist act will be considered to have occurred in Metropolitan France if a terrorist attack injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Conditional on the USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table calculated by the number of Gold Medals, Silver Medals, and Bronze Medals in that order. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, or if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team, this condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) USA will top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 (b) The Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) USA will top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024: This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

(b) The Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: If the Prime Minister of France is from a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France belongs to a party that is not New Popular Front or Together, according to credible sources. Then, will Meta publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models? The resolution of the outcome question is based on whether such a report is publicly available by the specified date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, AND (b) Meta will publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) The question about the Prime Minister of France will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) The question about Meta will resolve as Yes if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
[image]

Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Given USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Inflection publish a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The USD is worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance. Then, is it true that Inflection will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024? The report must be public and involve external red-teaming for it to count.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, and (b) Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The USD/JPY exchange rate must be >= 145 at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Inflection must publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Given 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out. This will be verified by the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. Then, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? The attack must occur after May 2, 2024, and credible sources must report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

(2) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Given S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Then, is it true that Mike Pence will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (2) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This is determined based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. (2) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. If both conditions are met, the answer is **Yes**; otherwise, it is **No**.

question.title: Will the Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024. (According to Kitco.com trading price @ 4pm EST.)
question.body:
This market will resolve yes if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Easter standard time on August 9th 2024. The price of 1 ounce of silver will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Should the price be exactly 30.50 USD per ounce of silver at 4pm on August 9th the market will resolve as no. The question is particularly specific to the point ABOVE $30.50USD. 

Should the price be at 30.50 USD or below 30.50 USD the market will resolve as a NO. 

I will do my best to resolve this market on time, if it hasn’t been resolved by 5pm EST time on August 9th 2024, please comment and remind me to resolve the marketplace! 

Thank you

question.title: Given silver closes above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, will Disney announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On August 9th, 2024, the price of 1 ounce of silver closes above $30.50 USD at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time, as determined by the live ticker price on Kitco.com. Then, will Disney announce a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The market resolves YES if the price of silver is above $30.50 USD at exactly 4pm EST on August 9th, 2024. It resolves NO if the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below at that time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if Disney announces a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024. It resolves NO if no new night time parade is announced or if an existing parade is moved to Florida.

question.title: Will the price of silver close above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, and will Disney announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom by D23 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve YES if both of the following occur: (1) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. The price must be strictly above $30.50 USD; if it is exactly $30.50 USD or below, it will resolve as NO. (2) Disney announces a new nighttime parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024. This will resolve NO if no new nighttime parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is announced to be moving to Florida. The resolution of this question will depend on both conditions being satisfied.

question.title: Conditional on Sha'Carri Richardson winning a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, will Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race?
question.body:

Given this condition, will Mathieu van der Poel rank higher than Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race, scheduled to start on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m.? question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning, will Mayor Wilson attend the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

Then, is it true that Mayor Kurt Wilson will be physically present at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024? If he dials in on Zoom, it will resolve to yes, but we need confirmation it's him (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). 

Resolves to NO if Mayor Wilson isn't there.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, and (b) Mayor Wilson shows at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. If he dials in on Zoom, it will resolve to YES, but we need confirmation it's him (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). Resolves NO if he isn't there.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Given BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before June 6, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Les Républicains forming an alliance with the National Rally, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. Then, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected, and No otherwise. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention, not on the outcome of the election day.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France forms an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election and (b) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (2) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either of these conditions is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing his resignation and dropping out, will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning from the presidency, although he does not have to have formally resigned by then. Given this scenario, will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM VET, with results representing 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish? Resolves YES if credible sources report such publication by the deadline. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, and (b) the Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part of the question.

Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: If an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as **Yes** if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics and the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

question.title: Conditional on UCLA holding its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies on June 14, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question examines two separate events and their correlation:

1. **Condition (P):** UCLA must hold all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 at the Pauley Pavilion on June 14, 2024. The ceremonies must begin within 1 hour of the scheduled times: 11 AM, 3 PM, and 7 PM. The question resolves as No if any ceremony is delayed, relocated, or held entirely online.

2. **Outcome (Q):** The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023. This is based on data from the St. Louis Fed.

Suppose the following is true: UCLA holds its in-person ceremonies as scheduled on June 14, 2024. Then, is the VXVCLS higher on July 20, 2024, compared to the same date in 2023?

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024, AND will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 at the specified times and location on June 14, 2024:
   - 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
   - 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
   - 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

   The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. This condition will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Vivek Ramaswamy must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: ECR must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. In the case of a tie for the most seats, this will also resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes scenarios where ECR is tied for the most seats. The resolution is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

The question will resolve as **No** if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

question.title: Will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections.  All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024)

question.title: Conditional on BJP forming the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which are expected to occur in May 2024. Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The BJP must have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

question.title: Will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 and will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) The BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which are expected for May 2024. (b) A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Biden remains President through July 2024, will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024. This means he does not resign, die, or cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not affect this status.

Then, is it true that Team USA will win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics? Resolves YES if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves NO if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 and will the US win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then (temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President for this purpose); (b) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, meaning both teams must win gold medals. If either condition is not met, the question resolves NO.

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Then, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following events occur, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China.
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (2) diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. By June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

2. Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If both conditions are satisfied, this question resolves as **YES**. Otherwise, it resolves as **NO**.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, have a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6? This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") during that period is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (b) The strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body:
(a) A terrorist act will be considered to have occurred in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will have a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6 if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") during this period is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Nvidia's market capitalization exceed Apple's on July 17, 2024, if a group of at least 5 named Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden to drop out, and two endangered Democrats have expressed doubts about Biden's chances in November. Behind the scenes, drafts of letters by House Democrats urge Biden to end his campaign. This market resolves YES if at least five named Democratic US House Members or Senators collectively ask Biden to consider ending his 2024 campaign before July 20th, whether through a letter or group meeting. All five must be part of the same group message. Unnamed reports need confirmation of names by the end date. If criteria aren't met by July 20th, it resolves NO.

This conditional question asks: Suppose the above condition is true, will Nvidia's market cap be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024? This resolves YES if Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's on that date, according to Companies Market Cap, checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th? (b) On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body:
(a) Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(b) This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.
