question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Conditional on INC forming the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, expected to occur by May 2024. Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The INC must have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024? (b) Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. Then, will the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** be higher than $185,548,391, the sum of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must win the 2024 NBA Finals.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** must exceed $185,548,391 as reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page. Resolves YES if it does, NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, and (b) the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), and (2) the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. It resolves as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Given that at least 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. All other outcomes resolve "No".

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics and will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) Paris Saint-Germain wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes resolve "No".

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Conditional on 'Deadpool & Wolverine' having the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

To clarify on resolution:
- This market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
- AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

Suppose the above condition is true. Then, will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question will resolve as YES if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Deadpool x Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, and (2) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
1. Will "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for the film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, with projections between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would surpass the original Deadpool's record of $284.5M globally. The market will resolve YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

2. Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as YES if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dying before Saturday, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, as confirmed by an official announcement. Given this condition, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election for any reason. Resolves NO if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in that election. Resolution should cite credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

If the condition regarding Joe Biden's death is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, and (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as NO. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will Cristiano Ronaldo score a goal during Euro 2024?
question.body:
He has yet to score a goal during the European Cup. Will he end up goalless or will he score?

Will resolve NO if he doesn't.

question.title: Conditional on Cristiano Ronaldo scoring a goal during Euro 2024, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Cristiano Ronaldo scores a goal during Euro 2024. A goal is counted if it is listed on the official UEFA Euro 2024 statistics page, excluding penalties scored during shoot-outs and own goals.

Now, consider the 2024 Olympics. Will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo?

The question resolves as YES if the same NOC wins at least two of these events. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Cristiano Ronaldo scores a goal during Euro 2024 and (b) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) Cristiano Ronaldo must score a goal during Euro 2024. This will resolve YES if he scores according to https://www.uefa.com/euro2024/statistics/players/goals/. It will resolve NO if he doesn't. Penalties scored during penalty shoot-outs and own goals do not count.

(b) The same nation must win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This resolves as NO if women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees win gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as YES if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on S&D holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, as determined by official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Then, will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics? An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes scenarios where S&D is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. (b) A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question resolves as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Biden remains President through the end of July 2024, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if Biden remains President and does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President.

Then, is it true that the European Union will announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This resolves YES if credible sources report that the EU has announced new tariffs or duties to be imposed on Chinese electric vehicles before the specified date.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024 AND will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Then, will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo is higher than $185,548,391, which is the combined total of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). This question follows the resolution of the original on Metaculus.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (b) the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. For the box office question, resolution criteria and additional information can be found on Metaculus. The resolution will follow the original Metaculus question once it resolves.

question.title: Will "Borderlands" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B- or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Borderlands" (2024) receives a B- CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a C+ or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

"Borderlands" is the adaptation of the hugely popular video game franchise.

Here's a list of CinemaScores for previous video game adaptations.

question.title: Given "Borderlands" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B- or above, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where "Borderlands" (2024), an adaptation of the popular video game franchise, receives a CinemaScore of B- or higher. The CinemaScore is a measure of audience reception, and if it is not reported, the condition resolves as N/A.

Given this condition, the question asks whether the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 will break the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds. The resolution criteria for this are based on official results posted by the International Olympic Committee or other credible sources. If any athlete runs the race in less than 9.63 seconds, it resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) "Borderlands" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B- or above and (b) the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) "Borderlands" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B- or higher, and (b) any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If either condition is not met, this resolves as NO. If a CinemaScore is not reported for "Borderlands" (2024), this resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday?
question.body: This market will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET

question.title: Conditional on Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday, will the maximum weekly rate of US hospitalizations occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in 2023-24?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Then, will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before the specified date and time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four weeks will be based on the week end dates, following CDC's "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. The season is considered from October 7, 2023, to June 1, 2024.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday August 3rd, 2024? (b) Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
(a) This part will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) This part will resolve YES if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. The question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Ted Cruz being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:

Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on S&D holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, given this condition, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.
